trans-unit.source: Introduction to Microsoft Azure DocumentDB - Free Trial | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Introduction to Microsoft Azure DocumentDB - Free Trial | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn about Azure DocumentDB, a NoSQL document database, and its value to cloud and mobile applications. Learn how it manages data, and how you can use it in application development.
trans-unit.target: Learn about Azure DocumentDB, a NoSQL document database, and its value to cloud and mobile applications. Learn how it manages data, and how you can use it in application development.

trans-unit.source: Introduction to Microsoft Azure DocumentDB
trans-unit.target: Introduction to Microsoft Azure DocumentDB

trans-unit.source: This article provides an introduction to Microsoft Azure DocumentDB, a fully-managed NoSQL document database service for developers, IT Pros, and business decision makers.
trans-unit.target: This article provides an introduction to Microsoft Azure DocumentDB, a fully-managed NoSQL document database service for developers, IT Pros, and business decision makers.

trans-unit.source: A quick way to learn about DocumentDB and see it in action is to follow these three steps:
trans-unit.target: A quick way to learn about DocumentDB and see it in action is to follow these three steps:

trans-unit.source: Watch the two minute <link><linkText>What is DocumentDB?</linkText><title></title></link> video, which introduces the benefits of using DocumentDB.
trans-unit.target: Watch the two minute <link><linkText>What is DocumentDB?</linkText><title></title></link> video, which introduces the benefits of using DocumentDB.

trans-unit.source: Watch the three minute <link><linkText>Create DocumentDB on Azure</linkText><title></title></link> video, which highlights how to get started with DocumentDB by using the Azure preview portal.
trans-unit.target: Watch the three minute <link><linkText>Create DocumentDB on Azure</linkText><title></title></link> video, which highlights how to get started with DocumentDB by using the Azure preview portal.

trans-unit.source: Visit the <link><linkText>Query Playground</linkText><title></title></link>, where you can walk through different activities to learn about the rich querying functionality available in DocumentDB.
trans-unit.target: Visit the <link><linkText>Query Playground</linkText><title></title></link>, where you can walk through different activities to learn about the rich querying functionality available in DocumentDB.

trans-unit.source: Then, head over to the Sandbox tab and run your own custom SQL queries and experiment with DocumentDB.
trans-unit.target: Then, head over to the Sandbox tab and run your own custom SQL queries and experiment with DocumentDB.

trans-unit.source: Then, return to this article, where we'll dig in deeper and you'll learn the answers to the following questions:
trans-unit.target: Then, return to this article, where we'll dig in deeper and you'll learn the answers to the following questions:

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>What is DocumentDB and what value does it provide to cloud and mobile applications?</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>What is DocumentDB and what value does it provide to cloud and mobile applications?</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>How is my data managed in DocumentDB and how do I access it?</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>How is my data managed in DocumentDB and how do I access it?</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>How do I develop applications using DocumentDB?</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>How do I develop applications using DocumentDB?</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>What are my next steps to build a DocumentDB application?</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>What are my next steps to build a DocumentDB application?</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: What is Azure DocumentDB?
trans-unit.target: What is Azure DocumentDB?

trans-unit.source: Modern applications produce, consume and respond quickly to very large volumes of data.
trans-unit.target: Modern applications produce, consume and respond quickly to very large volumes of data.

trans-unit.source: These applications evolve very rapidly and so does the underlying data schema.
trans-unit.target: These applications evolve very rapidly and so does the underlying data schema.

trans-unit.source: In response to this, developers have increasingly chosen schema-free NoSQL document databases as simple, fast, scalable solutions to store and process data while preserving the ability to quickly iterate over application data models and unstructured data feeds.
trans-unit.target: In response to this, developers have increasingly chosen schema-free NoSQL document databases as simple, fast, scalable solutions to store and process data while preserving the ability to quickly iterate over application data models and unstructured data feeds.

trans-unit.source: However, many schema-free databases do not allow for complex queries and transactional processing, making advanced data management difficult.
trans-unit.target: However, many schema-free databases do not allow for complex queries and transactional processing, making advanced data management difficult.

trans-unit.source: This is where DocumentDB comes in.
trans-unit.target: This is where DocumentDB comes in.

trans-unit.source: Microsoft developed DocumentDB to fulfill these requirements when managing data for today's applications.
trans-unit.target: Microsoft developed DocumentDB to fulfill these requirements when managing data for today's applications.

trans-unit.source: DocumentDB is a true schema-free NoSQL document database service designed for modern mobile and web applications.
trans-unit.target: DocumentDB is a true schema-free NoSQL document database service designed for modern mobile and web applications.

trans-unit.source: DocumentDB delivers consistently fast reads and writes, schema flexibility, and the ability to easily scale a database up and down on demand.
trans-unit.target: DocumentDB delivers consistently fast reads and writes, schema flexibility, and the ability to easily scale a database up and down on demand.

trans-unit.source: It does not assume or require any schema for the JSON documents it indexes.
trans-unit.target: It does not assume or require any schema for the JSON documents it indexes.

trans-unit.source: By default, it automatically indexes all the documents in the database and does not expect or require any schema or creation of secondary indices.
trans-unit.target: By default, it automatically indexes all the documents in the database and does not expect or require any schema or creation of secondary indices.

trans-unit.source: DocumentDB enables complex ad hoc queries using a SQL language, supports well defined consistency levels, and offers JavaScript language integrated, multi-document transaction processing using the familiar programming model of stored procedures, triggers, and UDFs.
trans-unit.target: DocumentDB enables complex ad hoc queries using a SQL language, supports well defined consistency levels, and offers JavaScript language integrated, multi-document transaction processing using the familiar programming model of stored procedures, triggers, and UDFs.

trans-unit.source: DocumentDB natively supports JSON documents enabling easy iteration of application schema.
trans-unit.target: DocumentDB natively supports JSON documents enabling easy iteration of application schema.

trans-unit.source: It embraces the ubiquity of JSON and JavaScript, eliminating mismatch between application defined objects and database schema.
trans-unit.target: It embraces the ubiquity of JSON and JavaScript, eliminating mismatch between application defined objects and database schema.

trans-unit.source: Deep integration of JavaScript also allows developers to execute application logic efficiently and directly - within the database engine in a database transaction.
trans-unit.target: Deep integration of JavaScript also allows developers to execute application logic efficiently and directly - within the database engine in a database transaction.

trans-unit.source: Azure DocumentDB offers the following key capabilities and benefits:
trans-unit.target: Azure DocumentDB offers the following key capabilities and benefits:

trans-unit.source: Ad hoc queries with familiar SQL syntax: Store heterogeneous JSON documents within DocumentDB and query these documents through a familiar SQL syntax.
trans-unit.target: Ad hoc queries with familiar SQL syntax: Store heterogeneous JSON documents within DocumentDB and query these documents through a familiar SQL syntax.

trans-unit.source: DocumentDB utilizes a highly concurrent, lock free, log structured indexing technology to automatically index all document content.
trans-unit.target: DocumentDB utilizes a highly concurrent, lock free, log structured indexing technology to automatically index all document content.

trans-unit.source: This enables rich real-time queries without the need to specify schema hints, secondary indexes, or views.
trans-unit.target: This enables rich real-time queries without the need to specify schema hints, secondary indexes, or views.

trans-unit.source: Learn more in <link><linkText>Query DocumentDB</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: Learn more in <link><linkText>Query DocumentDB</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: JavaScript execution within the database: Express application logic as stored procedures, triggers, and user defined functions (UDFs) using standard JavaScript.
trans-unit.target: JavaScript execution within the database: Express application logic as stored procedures, triggers, and user defined functions (UDFs) using standard JavaScript.

trans-unit.source: This allows your application logic to operate over JSON data without worrying about the mismatch between the application and the database schema.
trans-unit.target: This allows your application logic to operate over JSON data without worrying about the mismatch between the application and the database schema.

trans-unit.source: DocumentDB provides full transactional execution of JavaScript application logic directly inside the database engine.
trans-unit.target: DocumentDB provides full transactional execution of JavaScript application logic directly inside the database engine.

trans-unit.source: The deep integration of JavaScript enables the execution of INSERT, REPLACE, DELETE, and SELECT operations from within a JavaScript program as an isolated transaction.
trans-unit.target: The deep integration of JavaScript enables the execution of INSERT, REPLACE, DELETE, and SELECT operations from within a JavaScript program as an isolated transaction.

trans-unit.source: Learn more in <link><linkText>DocumentDB server-side programming</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: Learn more in <link><linkText>DocumentDB server-side programming</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Tunable consistency levels: Select from four well defined consistency levels to achieve optimal trade-off between consistency and performance.
trans-unit.target: Tunable consistency levels: Select from four well defined consistency levels to achieve optimal trade-off between consistency and performance.

trans-unit.source: For queries and read operations, DocumentDB offers four distinct consistency levels: strong, bounded-staleness, session, and eventual.
trans-unit.target: For queries and read operations, DocumentDB offers four distinct consistency levels: strong, bounded-staleness, session, and eventual.

trans-unit.source: These granular, well-defined consistency levels allow you to make sound trade-offs between consistency, availability, and latency.
trans-unit.target: These granular, well-defined consistency levels allow you to make sound trade-offs between consistency, availability, and latency.

trans-unit.source: Learn more in <link><linkText>Using consistency levels to maximize availability and performance in DocumentDB</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: Learn more in <link><linkText>Using consistency levels to maximize availability and performance in DocumentDB</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Fully managed: Eliminate the need to manage database and machine resources.
trans-unit.target: Fully managed: Eliminate the need to manage database and machine resources.

trans-unit.source: As a fully-managed Microsoft Azure service, you do not need to manage virtual machines, deploy and configure software, or deal with complex data-tier upgrades.
trans-unit.target: As a fully-managed Microsoft Azure service, you do not need to manage virtual machines, deploy and configure software, or deal with complex data-tier upgrades.

trans-unit.source: Every database is automatically backed up and protected against regional failures.
trans-unit.target: Every database is automatically backed up and protected against regional failures.

trans-unit.source: You can easily add a DocumentDB account and provision capacity as you need it, allowing you to focus on your application instead of operating and managing your database.
trans-unit.target: You can easily add a DocumentDB account and provision capacity as you need it, allowing you to focus on your application instead of operating and managing your database.

trans-unit.source: Elastically scalable throughput and storage: Easily scale up or scale down DocumentDB to meet your application needs.
trans-unit.target: Elastically scalable throughput and storage: Easily scale up or scale down DocumentDB to meet your application needs.

trans-unit.source: Scaling is done through fine grained units (collections) of reserved SSD backed storage and throughput.
trans-unit.target: Scaling is done through fine grained units (collections) of reserved SSD backed storage and throughput.

trans-unit.source: You can elastically scale DocumentDB with predictable performance by creating more units as your application grows.
trans-unit.target: You can elastically scale DocumentDB with predictable performance by creating more units as your application grows.

trans-unit.source: Open by design: Get started quickly by using existing skills and tools.
trans-unit.target: Open by design: Get started quickly by using existing skills and tools.

trans-unit.source: Programming against DocumentDB is simple, approachable, and does not require you to adopt new tools or adhere to custom extensions to JSON or JavaScript.
trans-unit.target: Programming against DocumentDB is simple, approachable, and does not require you to adopt new tools or adhere to custom extensions to JSON or JavaScript.

trans-unit.source: You can access all of the database functionality including CRUD, query, and JavaScript processing over a simple RESTful HTTP interface.
trans-unit.target: You can access all of the database functionality including CRUD, query, and JavaScript processing over a simple RESTful HTTP interface.

trans-unit.source: DocumentDB embraces existing formats, languages, and standards while offering high value database capabilities on top of them.
trans-unit.target: DocumentDB embraces existing formats, languages, and standards while offering high value database capabilities on top of them.

trans-unit.source: You can use DocumentDB to store flexible datasets that require query retrieval and transactional processing.
trans-unit.target: You can use DocumentDB to store flexible datasets that require query retrieval and transactional processing.

trans-unit.source: Application scenarios may include user data for interactive web and mobile applications as well as storage, retrieval, and processing of application JSON data.
trans-unit.target: Application scenarios may include user data for interactive web and mobile applications as well as storage, retrieval, and processing of application JSON data.

trans-unit.source: A database can store any number of JSON documents, as DocumentDB is well suited for applications that run at scale on the internet.
trans-unit.target: A database can store any number of JSON documents, as DocumentDB is well suited for applications that run at scale on the internet.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Azure DocumentDB resources
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Azure DocumentDB resources

trans-unit.source: Azure DocumentDB manages data through well-defined database resources.
trans-unit.target: Azure DocumentDB manages data through well-defined database resources.

trans-unit.source: These resources are replicated for high availability and are uniquely addressable by their logical URI.
trans-unit.target: These resources are replicated for high availability and are uniquely addressable by their logical URI.

trans-unit.source: DocumentDB offers a simple HTTP based RESTful programming model for all resources.
trans-unit.target: DocumentDB offers a simple HTTP based RESTful programming model for all resources.

trans-unit.source: The DocumentDB database account is a unique namespace that gives you access to Azure DocumentDB.
trans-unit.target: The DocumentDB database account is a unique namespace that gives you access to Azure DocumentDB.

trans-unit.source: Before you can create a database account, you must have an Azure subscription, which gives you access to a variety of Azure services.
trans-unit.target: Before you can create a database account, you must have an Azure subscription, which gives you access to a variety of Azure services.

trans-unit.source: All resources within DocumentDB are modeled and stored as JSON documents.
trans-unit.target: All resources within DocumentDB are modeled and stored as JSON documents.

trans-unit.source: Resources are managed as items, which are JSON documents containing metadata, and as feeds which are collections of items.
trans-unit.target: Resources are managed as items, which are JSON documents containing metadata, and as feeds which are collections of items.

trans-unit.source: Sets of items are contained within their respective feeds.
trans-unit.target: Sets of items are contained within their respective feeds.

trans-unit.source: The image below shows the relationships between the DocumentDB resources:
trans-unit.target: The image below shows the relationships between the DocumentDB resources:

trans-unit.source: A database account consists of a set of databases, each containing multiple collections, each of which can contain stored procedures, triggers, UDFs, documents, and related attachments.
trans-unit.target: A database account consists of a set of databases, each containing multiple collections, each of which can contain stored procedures, triggers, UDFs, documents, and related attachments.

trans-unit.source: A database also has associated users, each with a set of permissions to access various other collections, stored procedures, triggers, UDFs, documents, or attachments.
trans-unit.target: A database also has associated users, each with a set of permissions to access various other collections, stored procedures, triggers, UDFs, documents, or attachments.

trans-unit.source: While databases, users, permissions, and collections are system-defined resources with well-known schemas - documents, stored procedures, triggers, UDFs, and attachments contain arbitrary, user defined JSON content.
trans-unit.target: While databases, users, permissions, and collections are system-defined resources with well-known schemas - documents, stored procedures, triggers, UDFs, and attachments contain arbitrary, user defined JSON content.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html> Developing with Azure DocumentDB
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html> Developing with Azure DocumentDB

trans-unit.source: Azure DocumentDB exposes resources through a REST API that can be called by any language capable of making HTTP/HTTPS requests.
trans-unit.target: Azure DocumentDB exposes resources through a REST API that can be called by any language capable of making HTTP/HTTPS requests.

trans-unit.source: Additionally, DocumentDB offers programming libraries for several popular languages.
trans-unit.target: Additionally, DocumentDB offers programming libraries for several popular languages.

trans-unit.source: These libraries simplify many aspects of working with Azure DocumentDB by handling details such as address caching, exception management, automatic retries and so forth.
trans-unit.target: These libraries simplify many aspects of working with Azure DocumentDB by handling details such as address caching, exception management, automatic retries and so forth.

trans-unit.source: Libraries are currently available for the following languages and platforms:
trans-unit.target: Libraries are currently available for the following languages and platforms:

trans-unit.source: Download
trans-unit.target: Download

trans-unit.target: Documentation

trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>.NET SDK</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>.NET library</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Node.js SDK</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Node.js library</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Java SDK</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Java library</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>JavaScript SDK</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>JavaScript library</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.target: n/a

trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Server-side JavaScript SDK</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Python SDK</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Python library</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: Beyond basic create, read, update, and delete operations, DocumentDB provides a rich SQL query interface for retrieving JSON documents and server side support for transactional execution of JavaScript application logic.
trans-unit.target: Beyond basic create, read, update, and delete operations, DocumentDB provides a rich SQL query interface for retrieving JSON documents and server side support for transactional execution of JavaScript application logic.

trans-unit.source: The query and script execution interfaces are available through all platform libraries as well as the REST APIs.
trans-unit.target: The query and script execution interfaces are available through all platform libraries as well as the REST APIs.

trans-unit.source: SQL query
trans-unit.target: SQL query

trans-unit.source: Azure DocumentDB supports querying documents using a SQL language, which is rooted in the JavaScript type system, and expressions with support for rich hierarchical queries.
trans-unit.target: Azure DocumentDB supports querying documents using a SQL language, which is rooted in the JavaScript type system, and expressions with support for rich hierarchical queries.

trans-unit.source: The DocumentDB query language is a simple yet powerful interface to query JSON documents.
trans-unit.target: The DocumentDB query language is a simple yet powerful interface to query JSON documents.

trans-unit.source: The language supports a subset of ANSI SQL grammar and adds deep integration of JavaScript object, arrays, object construction, and function invocation.
trans-unit.target: The language supports a subset of ANSI SQL grammar and adds deep integration of JavaScript object, arrays, object construction, and function invocation.

trans-unit.source: DocumentDB provides its query model without any explicit schema or indexing hints from the developer.
trans-unit.target: DocumentDB provides its query model without any explicit schema or indexing hints from the developer.

trans-unit.source: User Defined Functions (UDFs) can be registered with DocumentDB and referenced as part of a SQL query, thereby extending the grammar to support custom application logic.
trans-unit.target: User Defined Functions (UDFs) can be registered with DocumentDB and referenced as part of a SQL query, thereby extending the grammar to support custom application logic.

trans-unit.source: These UDFs are written as JavaScript programs and executed within the database.
trans-unit.target: These UDFs are written as JavaScript programs and executed within the database.

trans-unit.source: For .NET developers, DocumentDB also offers a LINQ query provider as part of the <link><linkText>.NET SDK</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For .NET developers, DocumentDB also offers a LINQ query provider as part of the <link><linkText>.NET SDK</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Transactions and JavaScript execution
trans-unit.target: Transactions and JavaScript execution

trans-unit.source: DocumentDB allows you to write application logic as named programs written entirely in JavaScript.
trans-unit.target: DocumentDB allows you to write application logic as named programs written entirely in JavaScript.

trans-unit.source: These programs are registered for a collection and can issue database operations on the documents within a given collection.
trans-unit.target: These programs are registered for a collection and can issue database operations on the documents within a given collection.

trans-unit.source: JavaScript can be registered for execution as a trigger, stored procedure or user defined function.
trans-unit.target: JavaScript can be registered for execution as a trigger, stored procedure or user defined function.

trans-unit.source: Triggers and stored procedures can create, read, update, and delete documents whereas user defined functions execute as part of the query execution logic without write access to the collection.
trans-unit.target: Triggers and stored procedures can create, read, update, and delete documents whereas user defined functions execute as part of the query execution logic without write access to the collection.

trans-unit.source: JavaScript execution within DocumentDB is modeled after the concepts supported by relational database systems, with JavaScript as a modern replacement for Transact-SQL.
trans-unit.target: JavaScript execution within DocumentDB is modeled after the concepts supported by relational database systems, with JavaScript as a modern replacement for Transact-SQL.

trans-unit.source: All JavaScript logic is executed within an ambient ACID transaction with snapshot isolation.
trans-unit.target: All JavaScript logic is executed within an ambient ACID transaction with snapshot isolation.

trans-unit.source: During the course of its execution, if the JavaScript throws an exception, then the entire transaction is aborted.
trans-unit.target: During the course of its execution, if the JavaScript throws an exception, then the entire transaction is aborted.

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: If you already have an Azure account, you can get started with DocumentDB in the <link><linkText>Azure preview portal</linkText><title></title></link> by <link><linkText>creating a DocumentDB database account</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: If you already have an Azure account, you can get started with DocumentDB in the <link><linkText>Azure preview portal</linkText><title></title></link> by <link><linkText>creating a DocumentDB database account</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: If you don't have an Azure account, you can:
trans-unit.target: If you don't have an Azure account, you can:

trans-unit.source: Sign up for an <link><linkText>Azure free trial</linkText><title></title></link>, which gives you 30 days and $200 to try all the Azure services.
trans-unit.target: Sign up for an <link><linkText>Azure free trial</linkText><title></title></link>, which gives you 30 days and $200 to try all the Azure services.

trans-unit.source: If you have an MSDN subscription, you are eligible for <link><linkText>$150 in free Azure credits per month</linkText><title></title></link> to use on any Azure service.
trans-unit.target: If you have an MSDN subscription, you are eligible for <link><linkText>$150 in free Azure credits per month</linkText><title></title></link> to use on any Azure service.

trans-unit.source: Then, when you're ready to learn more, visit our <link><linkText>learning path</linkText><title></title></link> to navigate all the learning resources available to you.
trans-unit.target: Then, when you're ready to learn more, visit our <link><linkText>learning path</linkText><title></title></link> to navigate all the learning resources available to you.
